The burn rate while cooking these will decrease as players reach higher Cooking levels, stopping entirely at level 34. Players can also deliberately make burnt meat by cooking a piece of cooked meat, displaying the chatbox message "You deliberately burn the nicely cooked meat."

Item ID2146

Burnt meat is the result of accidentally burning various raw meat while attempting to make cooked meat. The burn rate while cooking these will decrease as players reach higher Cooking levels, stopping entirely at level 34. Players can also deliberately make burnt meat by cooking a piece of cooked meat, displaying the chatbox message "You deliberately burn the nicely cooked meat."

Burnt meat is used for the Witch's Potion quest. It is often dropped by Imps, and is also a reward from Burntmeat after Eadgar's Ruse and My Arm's Big Adventure.

Like most other burnt food, it is tradeable to other players but not on the Grand Exchange.

[[File:Burnt meat detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Burnt meat''' is the result of accidentally [[burnt food|burning]] various [[raw meat]] while attempting to make [[cooked meat]]. The [[burn rate]] while cooking these will decrease as players reach higher Cooking levels, stopping entirely at level 34. Players can also deliberately make burnt meat by cooking a piece of cooked meat, displaying the chatbox message "''You deliberately burn the nicely cooked meat.''"

Burnt meat is used for the [[Witch's Potion]] quest. It is often dropped by [[Imp]]s, and is also a reward from [[Burntmeat]] after [[Eadgar's Ruse]] and [[My Arm's Big Adventure]].

Like most other burnt food, it is tradeable to other players but not on the [[Grand Exchange]].
